author: joeymeluso
title: Like Batman with the Ability to Fly
review:
Christmas time brought me another LEGO Dimensions Fun Pack, this time it's Wonder Woman. Previously I discussed my underwhelming approval of Gollum, but Wonder Woman has more to bring to the toys-to-life table.

Box/Instructions

As a video game accessory, the box is small and simple to contain all of its parts in one bag. I found it peculiar that the Wonder Woman hair and lasso were together in a smaller specialized bag with the other parts (a bag I usually refer to as the "mold bag" for specialized or uncommon molds, i.e. Friends minidolls torsos and hair). The instructions were only to build the minifigure, so if one does not have the Starter Pack to get the digital instructions, they can find the instructions for each build on LEGO.com.

Parts

Outside of the minifigure, the parts are almost entirely the same color - trans-clear. Only a few parts are light bluish grey (5) and trans-red (4). This is helpful fo the intended "invisible" effect of the builds, while also offering a few interesting parts in trans-clear. Nothing new in trans-clear outside of the 1x1 studded pole or the 4 winglets with clips.

Minifigures

Wonder Woman is the same exact variant as in Superman vs Power Armor Lex (6862). If one didn't obtain that set, this figure is better to get recently and cheaper. However, it adds nothing new to the Wonder Woman wardrobe. I do like this classic color scheme better than the version from 76026, much like the Superman of the 6862 set.

IN GAME: Wonder Woman is as useful as Batman in game, and by that I mean the following abilities: she can target multiple items to destroy with a boomerang, and use her lasso to tug at a pulley. However, she can fly with the Wonder Woman theme playing in the background during flight, and her hearts are changed to silver (much like a vehicle's health), which makes her last better against foes attacking her.

The build

The build is simple yet interesting among each model. The parts are used well for their shapes and styles. All of the models are not the same appearance in game however, and a minifigure cannot fit on the toy form of each model.

The completed model

The Invisible Jet is an incredible miniature model. The light bluish grey elements are easily mixed in with the trans-clear elements to make the model on the whole seem clear. The style is unique, especially the use of clear bottles for the simulated projectiles. The winglets can move up and down on the model, which is the only play feature and involves 4 articulated points. I also found the front to hold up better than my expectations, as I was afraid while building that it will fall apart multiple times.

The Stealth Laser Shooter is interesting in shape, with the front wider than the middle and rear. The light bluish grey holds up well for the invisibility appearance, but it seems interesting that the bottles are used for two separate lasers, one behind another.

The Torpedo Bomber does an adequate job for the invisibility appearance. It looks interesting but slightly shorter than the previous models by a stud. Using the winglets on the back is creative but I fail to find the purpose of its shape.

IN GAME: Each model seems fast and able to fly easily in various levels, but the upgrades are simple and common among other vehicles. The Stealth Laser Shooter is helpful for a consistent laser shot when held down, or if one doesn't have a minifigure with a laser cutter ability.

Overall opinion

The minifugre is good for collecting if one doesn't already have it from its previous release in 2012. In game Wonder Woman is very useful, moreso than Batman in some ways. The Invisible Jet is my personal favorite of the three builds, with a good flow of style and believing its invisible appearance. The other models show the light bluish grey pieces slightly more than the jet, but they still have unique shapes. As toys they make interesting miniature display pieces, very limited on play features. In game the best uses are for flying and laser shooting, much like Benny's Spaceship. Not many characters have interacted with her in terms of voices, outside of Wyldstyle asking how she and Superman are doing, and Wicked Witch calling her "another Good Witch". I'm sure in future waves she will interact more with DC Comic characters like Superman.

author: 8BrickMario
title: Is it a wonder? Or should I wonder why I bought it?
review:
I was almost going to skip this pack, but I decided to get it to get an even number of purchases for a "buy one, get one 40% off" deal. Was it a wise purchase?

Box/Instructions

The box is pretty nice, with good artwork. 

Parts

...are very hard to see when building. Jokes aside, the pieces here are pretty good, with lots of clear pieces for the Invisible Jet. The NFC base for Wonder Woman is decorated nicely as usual, with her stacked-W logo on red, and the white stars on blue. 

Minifigures

Wonder Woman is the same as the 2012 version, so it's a great way to get her if you didn't the first time around. Her hair, legs, and lasso are all packaged separately, proof that they were all made in China. 

The build

The build was fairly simple, but I was surprised by the use of bottles as guns on the jet!

The completed model

The jet looks nice, and much more traditional than the full-sized one that came out last year. 

Gameplay

Like the Wicked Witch, Wonder Woman is another letter W-alliterative character who's basically an upgraded version of a Starter Pack character, namely, Batman. She has his ability to grapple and use boomerang switches, but trades stealth for mind control, super strength, and flight. She can also deflect lasers and dive underwater. As in LEGO Batman 3, whenever she flies, the Wonder Woman TV theme plays, which is a cute detail the first few times, but quickly becomes a bit annoying.

The Invisible Jet isn't very amazing, having the basic flying-vehicle abilities to pick up energy cargo and drop it into switches and to dock on jet switches and activate them. 

Overall opinion

I think this pack is a good option to have, but not necessary, as it doesn't unlock a new world, If you want an alternative to Batman, though, this is a good choice.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Dimensional Warrior Joins the Team.
review:
Set #71209 DC Comics Wonder Woman Fun Pack: LEGO Dimensions includes a large selection of 15$ products that are love’em or hate’em sets. They are also filled with interesting builds and ideas and characters, despite some of them being pretty identical to one another. That being said as a person invested in LEGO Dimensions I purchased every pack I could, so we’re on to reviewing the Fun Packs with this review and our first offering is Wonder Woman.

Packaging

Smaller sized variation of the Team Pack and Level Pack boxes, these ones take up much less space and feature the character and the toy on the front. Like with all boxes it’s the interesting looking plain blue design, that being said there’s also a shot of each character in action showing you who to get inside there.

I think the Fun Packs are the best designed as far as packaging are concerned, they’re the perfect size for pegs on the shelf and they include a fair number of diversity because of the large group of characters involved. So if you keep the packaging and hang them on your wall for display they’ll look great.

Parts

The set is filled with regular clear LEGO elements, a fairly large selection that look great and work well for any plans MOC fans may have. There are four of the LEGO flag elements with two clips in this set acting as wings for the Invisible Jet, perfect for some alternative build ideas.

Minifigures

Wonder Woman: This is pretty much identical to the Wonder Woman first released in the DC Super Heroes set Superman vs. Power Armor Lex. All of the parts and printing are pretty much the same, so if you bought that set you’ll have a double here. Her Toy Tag however has some unique printed design which does add to the look of the character when on display.

The build

Invisible Jet: Built mostly out of clear parts I’d say this build is pretty solid. It’s a fast and satisfying build. There are a few non-clear elements, but other than that nothing really stands out.

Stealth Laser Shooter: This alternative model is built with all of the same parts and looks pretty fun. The digital model looks better though comparing the two builds together.

Torpedo Bomber: This third variation on a model is meant to be an underwater vehicle I think, and the build reflects this, altering the profile and the wing configuration into an interesting looking model, I think it works better as a model compared to the second build. All three builds are similar to LEGO Polybags with miniature vehicles, this and the Jet could be sold by themselves for 5$ and work very well as models and fun little vehicle builds.

The completed model

Invisible Jet & Alternate Models: The main model is fun and exciting looking, it works very well as a model. Fun to play with, is a complete vehicle that can separate from the tag and fly around when not being used in-game.

The secondary model is a bit weaker, it fails to capture the look of the in-game version compared to the other two and suffers a bit from an overall odd design. Also the Invisible or Stealth look is a bit lot compared to the other two because the non-clear plates are more easily seen.

The third model, the Torpedo Bomber, looks great. It’s a very fun model and also works well as a vehicle that can be played with off the toy tag when you’re having a fun LEGO Dimensions day.

The Digital Content

The Adventure World: Wonder Woman grants access to the DC Super Heroes World and… well it’s an adventure world you get access to with the Starter Pack because it includes Batman, so really this is a pack you would purchase more for the character and the toy compared to anything available for the in-game, since it doesn’t include anything new as far as Adventure Worlds go.

Character & Vehicle Abilities: Wonder Woman can fly, she can also access acrobat puzzles, has mind control, laser deflector, invulnerability, can grapple, use her boomerang ability in place of Batman’s Batarangs, dive and destroy cracked LEGO objects.

The Invisible Jet is a flying vehicle and as such can use flight docks, flight cargo hooks and also has Stealth though isn’t ideal for stealth puzzles requiring pulling of switches. The secondary model once upgraded can do most of that and now destroy gold LEGO objects. The third model, despite sounding like it should, cannot dive underwater, but it can still use all of the flying vehicle abilities and ads destroy silver LEGO objects.

Overall opinion

Wonder Woman is an interesting character, but is it a must have Fun Pack? I suppose it depends on if you enjoy the character, definitely get it for discount prices if you’re a fan of LEGO Dimensions and want to experience the miniature models in this set, the vehicle builds are all mostly fairly fun to play with and display. Honestly though if you’re looking to just complete the game 100% Wonder Woman does not have any unique or puzzle specific abilities that aren’t found with other characters, so I can say safely this one might be one to skip. Recommended only for fans of the character or those who want a complete collection.
